item.title: Permanently Set File-Local Variables in Doom Emacs
item.description: From time to time, it’s useful to set local variables within an org file. For instance, I have a file whose subsections I’d like to encrypt. This being the case, I need to turn off autosave (since this could save plain text). To do this for the buffer, I add this to the top: 1 # -*- buffer-auto-save-file-name: nil; -*- Emacs is understandably wary of running elisp simply because it exists in the file, however.
